Message.Title: Buffet just said i will add....buy cheaper later......
Message.Msg: Buffett's stock holdings are always in focus, and he talked about his stake in International Business Machines (IBM) with CNBC. "I didn't buy more. I didn't sell any ... I won't be a seller of IBM. I may be a buyer from time to time." He revealed, "I think we may have added a little bit this year in the first quarter. I'm pretty sure we have." ( See Berkshire Hathaway's 15 biggest stock holdings. ) Meanwhile, the self-proclaimed, tech-phobic Buffett also made big news this week when he joined Twitter. His first tweet from @WarrenBuffett read, "Warren is in the house." (Read More: @WarrenBuffett Joins Twitter-He's 'in the House' ) Not surprisingly, he quickly attracted a big following. And as of Friday morning with only two tweets sent, he had over a quarter million followers. Buffett sent his inaugural tweet during a live streaming video interview with Fortune to promote his editorial in the magazine.

Topic.Title: Buffet just said i will add....buy cheaper later......

Message.Msg: I believe that Buffett has added on average 1 mil more IBM shares per Q. He finished 2012 with about 64 mil shares and had about 68 mil at the end of 2012. It appears so far that Buffett is adding to mirror IBM's buyback since he increased his shares by about 6% in 2012.

Message.Title: Berkshire Hathaway
Message.Msg: Berkshire Hathaway BRK.A +1.02% BRK.B +1.00% Chairman and CEO Warren Buffett, who joined the Twittersphere Thursday and already has a quarter million followers, is on a full-court media press ahead of the company’s annual meeting in Omaha. AFP/Getty Images The world’s newest billionaire tweeter told CNBC Friday the U.S. economy is improving, albeit not at “a very rapid clip.” He added that he may add to his holding of IBM IBM +1.14% “from time to time.” Berkshire has also trimmed its holdings of Moody’s MCO +2.82% .

Message.Title: LOTUS NOTES TRUELY SUCKS why you ask?
Message.Msg: When I paste some text into an email it hangs for about a minute trying to get the format the same. And I dont even want this, I want plain text everytime but it so well designed that if an option exists for it it is totally hidden. Been frustrated for 2 years now. hate it.. Then it occasionally hangs and I have to run a little program called kill notes

Message.Title: Detecting a pattern on the IBM message board
Message.Msg: On days when the stock is up, you get a half a dozen posts trashing the stock and predicting a market crash, for the down days you get a lot of 'I told you so's', and all from the same old usual suspects, so basically what you have are the sore losers who left the stock long ago and are too chicken to get back in at a higher price, and the trolls who, being trolls, are just being true to their nature
If you happen to know the hour on that day it would help as well - it's obvious that you are a genius investor (jamesstanit) and I'd like to take advantage of that.
10 times leveraged crooks

Topic.Title: IBM Gap Up over the next four trading days - enjoy!

Message.Msg: IBM filled the gaps for the days predicted 25, 26, 29 and 30. IBM is in range for stabilization $205-$210 and will climb above $220. Enjoy the weekend.

Topic.Title: Detecting a pattern on the IBM message board

Message.Msg: Detected same pattern about the time Yahoo changed its format. The majority of the Members that once added substance and made it informative seem to vanish or become scarce at that same point, giving way to your so called "trolls or poor losers." But there remain a half dozen or so that continue to enlighten me with their knowledge of IBM and the market.
